intro: Hieracium pendulum, commonly known as the hanging hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow-orange flowers are surrounded by a ring of bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hieracium pendulum is an annual or biennial plant, often found in disturbed habitats.
